sense.name: hit with something flat like a paddle or hand; impact as if by hitting.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Includes metaphorical usage. Syntax is: NP1[concrete] SLAP NP2[concrete]
sense.examples: I slapped the monkey high five as we drove by. Over the years who has slapped the fans the hardest - Marvel or DC? The leader slapped the moneylender with the back of his hand. His sandles slapped the sidewalk as he ran. Investors adjusted as soon as the new interest rate slapped the market.

sense.name: put or place haphazardly
sense.commentary: Includes: SLAP ON, SLAP TOGETHER Syntax includes: NP1[animate] SLAP NP2[patient] PP (usually ON) NP3 Note: Compare tp Sense 1: Context for Sense 2 must support a haphazard reading; motion along a path is not sufficient (see Sense 4).
sense.examples: The guy at the deli slapped mustard on my sandwich. I got out of class at 9 p.m., so I just slapped dinner together.

sense.name: put consequence or criticisms on
sense.commentary: NP1[animate] SLAP NP2[entity] (with NP3) Include: SLAP DOWN
sense.examples: The governor slapped the Illinois casinos with the largest tax rate in the country. The doctor slapped Helen on anti-depressants because of her recent breakdown. MySpace was slapped down for its apparent disregard for its content.

sense.name: dash or cast forcibly towards or away from something
sense.commentary: NOTE: a direction or motion of NP2 is required for this sense. Syntax is: NP1[animate] SLAP NP2[concrete] PP NP3 [concrete]
sense.examples: He slapped the milk out of the woman's hand. The child slapped the ball to his partner.
